meanings.definition: To occupy or live in (a property) as a tenant.
meanings.sent1: The family tenanted the cozy apartment near the park.
meanings.sent2: Many people choose to tenanted houses rather than buy them.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to tenanted the dog's bed for the day.
meanings.sent4: The idea of happiness tenanted her mind throughout the day.
meanings.sent5: The memories of her childhood tenanted her dreams at night.

meanings.sent1: The tenanted building had a lively atmosphere with all the residents.
meanings.sent2: The landlord was pleased to see the property fully tenanted.
meanings.sent3: The tenanted house next door always had delicious smells coming from the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a tenanted paradise for birds and squirrels.
meanings.sent5: The street was tenanted with friendly neighbors who always greeted each other warmly.
